title: Len Righton
text: Leonard Stephen "Len" Righton (12 October 1898 – 14 February 1972) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. Primarily a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Lock">lock</a>, Righton represented <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Auckland</a> at a provincial level, and was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, in 1923 and 1925. However, he missed selection for the <a href="1924%E2%80%9325%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Britain%2C%20Ireland%20and%20France">1924 "Invincibles" tour</a>. He played nine matches for the All Blacks but did not appear in any internationals.
